body: - fix units to be better readable (`Kb/sec` -> `kbit/sec`) - use `width` before `height` consistently - video -> audio typo --- for another pr: fix video being actually `Mbit/sec` https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/2782 - - - This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/TokTok/c-toxcore/2754)

comment_data.body: Why lowercase 'k' but upper case 'M'? Any reason for them not to be the same case?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -246,9 +246,9 @@ typedef enum Toxav_Err_Call {
  * receiving are both enabled by default.
  *
  * @param friend_number The friend number of the friend that should be called.
- * @param audio_bit_rate Audio bit rate in Kb/sec. Set this to 0 to disable
+ * @param audio_bit_rate Audio bit rate in kbit/sec. Set this to 0 to disable
  *   audio sending.
- * @param video_bit_rate Video bit rate in Kb/sec. Set this to 0 to disable
+ * @param video_bit_rate Video bit rate in Mbit/sec. Set this to 0 to disable

comment_data.body:
Hm, looking around, it looks like the lowercase 'k' and uppercase 'M' are customary letter cases so I guess that's fine.

https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data-rate_units
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -246,9 +246,9 @@ typedef enum Toxav_Err_Call {
  * receiving are both enabled by default.
  *
  * @param friend_number The friend number of the friend that should be called.
- * @param audio_bit_rate Audio bit rate in Kb/sec. Set this to 0 to disable
+ * @param audio_bit_rate Audio bit rate in kbit/sec. Set this to 0 to disable
  *   audio sending.
- * @param video_bit_rate Video bit rate in Kb/sec. Set this to 0 to disable
+ * @param video_bit_rate Video bit rate in Mbit/sec. Set this to 0 to disable

comment_data.body: Kilobit is written as "kb" in SI units. Second is written as "s" in SI units. You have improved one part, i.e. lower-cased the "k", but "bit" isn't anything ("t" might be tonnes, "T" might be tesla). What's the intention here?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -246,9 +246,9 @@ typedef enum Toxav_Err_Call {
  * receiving are both enabled by default.
  *
  * @param friend_number The friend number of the friend that should be called.
- * @param audio_bit_rate Audio bit rate in Kb/sec. Set this to 0 to disable
+ * @param audio_bit_rate Audio bit rate in kbit/sec. Set this to 0 to disable

comment_data.body: My brain needs the "bit" spelled out, or it will read "byte". I can make it kilobit if you find that more acceptable.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -246,9 +246,9 @@ typedef enum Toxav_Err_Call {
  * receiving are both enabled by default.
  *

- * @param audio_bit_rate Audio bit rate in Kb/sec. Set this to 0 to disable
+ * @param audio_bit_rate Audio bit rate in kbit/sec. Set this to 0 to disable

comment_data.body: also this commend kinda reminds me of what nurupo said above.

comment_data.body:
@iphydf "kbit" is definitely a thing. It's not a "kilo bi-something tonnes".

>[The kilobit has the unit symbol **kbit** or **kb**.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kilobit)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -246,9 +246,9 @@ typedef enum Toxav_Err_Call {
  * receiving are both enabled by default.
  *
  * @param friend_number The friend number of the friend that should be called.
- * @param audio_bit_rate Audio bit rate in Kb/sec. Set this to 0 to disable
+ * @param audio_bit_rate Audio bit rate in kbit/sec. Set this to 0 to disable

comment_regular_data.body:
acutally "b" (lowercase b) always means bits.
so Kb is always Kilobit(s).
versus KB and KiB

and video bitrate is correct as Kb/s (kilo bits per second).
its multiplied by 1000 later because vpx codec needs the value as b/s (bits per second)

well i am still checking this. its been a long time. hold on a bit ...

zoff is right, Kb and kbit are the same unit, so that particular unit is not really being fixed, just reworded. I do support the change though, being more explicit/clear in the documentation and spelling it out is probably a good thing.

> @zoff99 yea we multiply both audio and video rates by 1000, BUT `vpx_encoder.h`:
> 
> ```c
>   /*!\brief Target data rate
>    *
>    * Target bitrate to use for this stream, in kilobits per second.
>    */
>   unsigned int rc_target_bitrate;
> ```

yeah thats why i say im still checking. in my forks i think its correct but let me actually check ...

yeah its wrong in toktok:

https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/blob/5344d7f84d060311f2147b343cdd3fd4c433d7dd/toxav/video.c#L420

but fixed in mine:

https://github.com/zoff99/c-toxcore/blob/3511870af9928c7d09a47f0196ccb0ed3f0e0e9c/toxav/codecs/vpx/codec.c#L490

cfg2.rc_target_bitrate = (bit_rate / 1000);
sidenote: opus changed, and the new meaningful lower bound for the bitrate is `0.5` ...

but in any case the toxav PR needs to be merged first. fixes of old bugs come only afterwards.
we made a roadmap and agreed on it to my recollection
@zoff99 do we preserve behavoir and adjust the comments (this pr as-is) or do we fix it and change behavior?

> but in any case the toxav PR needs to be merged first. fixes of old bugs come only afterwards. we made a roadmap and agreed on it to my recollection

This pr has no conflicts with your pr, so that does not really matter, only if we change the code.


Also, someone needs to fix circle ci first ...

i would imagine we rebase and tweak this PR after toxav pr is merged.
what are the blockers now that the toxav PR can't be merged now-ish ? then lets address those, if any.

and which one is "the one" ?
https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/1431
https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/2651
(shrug)

> and which one is "the one" ? #1431 #2651 (shrug)

Oh I did not even see the other. the newer one has no conflicts, so...
back to draft, until either toxav prs is merged.

Update: this no longer changes the described bitrate of video to mega bits.
https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/2782

performed_via_github_app.description:
Codecov provides highly integrated tools to group, merge, archive and compare coverage reports. Whether your team is comparing changes in a pull request or reviewing a single commit, Codecov will improve the code review workflow and quality.

## Code coverage done right.®

1. Upload coverage reports from your CI builds.
2. Codecov merges all builds and languages into one beautiful coherent report.
3. Get commit statuses, pull request comments and coverage overlay via our browser extension.

When Codecov merges your uploads it keeps track of the CI provider (inc. build details) and user specified context, e.g. `#unittest` ~ `#smoketest` or `#oldcode` ~ `#newcode`. You can track the `#unittest` coverage independently of other groups. [Learn more here](
http://docs.codecov.io/docs/flags)

Through **Codecov's Browser Extension** reports overlay directly in GitHub UI to assist in code review in [Chrome](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/codecov/gedikamndpbemklijjkncpnolildpbgo) or Firefox (https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/codecov/)

*Highly detailed* **pull request comments** and *customizable* **commit statuses** will improve your team's workflow and code coverage incrementally.

**File backed configuration** all through the `codecov.yml`. 

## FAQ
- Do you **merge multiple uploads** to the same commit? **Yes**
- Do you **support multiple languages** in the same project? **Yes**
- Can you **group coverage reports** by project and/or test type? **Yes**
- How does **pricing** work? Only paid users can view reports and post statuses/comments.

comment_regular_data.body: That's good. The Mbit change is API / behavior breaking, so it's good to have it in a separate PR until we are ready to break the API.

>The Mbit change is API / behavior breaking, so it's good to have it in a separate PR until we are ready to break the API.

I would like to correct my earlier comment that that Mbit change is, in fact, not API breaking.

I thought the API used to say Mbit/s before, due to various force-push diffs in this PR doing the Mbit/s -> kbit/s function doc change, in which case changing it to kbit/s would be API-breaking, but I went and checked 5 years worth of the past revisions of toxav.h and apparently it has always been kbit/s, so no API is being broken.
@nurupo yep, and it's fixed now on master https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/2782

Yeah, that PR being merged so unceremoniously is what made me go back and double-check if it was actually API breaking or not, before I yell at iphydf for breaking the API. Apparently it wasn't, which is good.

commit.message:
docs(toxav): fix docs of toxav.h
- fix units to be more readable
- use width before height consistently
- video -> audio typo
